title: How to fix the Support item issues
body:
Step 1:  Create 4 tier 2 sightstone items, like this:

http://i.imgur.com/Nml7X4A.png http://i.imgur.com/QXc3e4t.png http://i.imgur.com/7J0bqjm.png http://i.imgur.com/pEYaCrf.png

Step 2:  Have sightstone build into an enchant on the support gold items instead of using questionable choices like {{item:3108}} or {{item:3114}} 

http://i.imgur.com/z4q7T5E.png

And voila, supports get their choice of TWELVE (3 items x 4 enchants) core items!  They get to start customizing their build path, not just after gp10 item, sightstone, and boots, but they get to customize their build before they even get sightstone!

Hell, you could even let jungle items or tier 2 items like {{item:3135}}, {{item:3035}}, and {{item:3075}} upgrade with sight enchants and let everyone play the vision game, which was the main reason for introducing trinkets and sightstone in the first place, wasn't it?

replies.body:
This would mean that the active from the support item will be removed. It will either become an aura or moved to another item. I'm okay with that. I also really like the enchantment idea.

I have a concern regarding cost efficiency, though.

{{item:1028}} + {{item:1006}} = 580g (220g more for 800g)
{{item:1027}} + {{item:1004}} = 580g (220g more for 800g)
{{item:1052}} + {{item:1004}} = 615g (205g more for 800g)
{{item:1036}} + {{item:1051}} = 720g (80g more for 800g)

This means that if the sightstone cost is still at 800g, the ward passive will be really cheap. It's currently 400g (which I find reasonable, as it breaks even at placing 6 wards), but it can become as low as 80g (which breaks even at 2 wards).
A way to mitigate this will be raising the price of sightstone. If we maintain the passive cost efficiency as 400g, then the most expensive sightstone (the AD option) will be 1120g. This is pretty difficult to purchase. I think maintaining the recipe as item+(about 400 gold)=sightstone is a good idea. My suggestion therefore is

{{item:1028}} + 400g = Sightstone (+150 Health)
{{item:1027}} + 400g = Sightstone (+200 Mana)
{{item:1036}} + 440g = Sightstone  (+10 AD)
{{item:1052}} + 365g = Sightstone (+20 AP)

They are all 800g in total. I don't think adding mana regen is necessary because you can get it from gp10 item.

So I'd almost rather have enchantments to enhance sightstones, rather than using sightstones to enhance another item.
This actually does sound fun. I sure would enjoy not needing sightstone to fill a whole spot.

Well, technically I'm not against combining Sightstone into the gold gen items.  It's an interesting idea, junglers are less able to buy sightstone then also, meaning more tactical warding rather than mass warding.  However, this is a bit more complicated than anything else they've done.

I'd still prefer if they just created a "two slot" system for trinkets.

Slot 1)  Vision slot - choice between a warding trinket, or a scrying trinket
Slot 2)  Vision Denial slot - Choice between a Scanner, and a pink ward trinket.

Remove store bought wards.  Forces every member to play in both parts of the vision war the entire game, and doesn't put an economic cost to warding/dewarding.

They could even expand on this with Slot 1 having that Mandrake ward which has been sporadically tested, and short duration Oracles for slot 2.

Remove store bought wards.... I'm sorry, WHAT?!
You really think i can keep ward coverage in bot lane with just a trinket? Even if my ADC joins in (they won't) that's two wards. max. every two minutes. It's bad enough trying to ward with only 3 wards available, but then you want to remove wards? Absolutely not.

Dawngate (which was awesome before EA killed it, screw EA) didn't have any form of purchasing vision. 
Everyone had a ward button and that's it, its cooldown matched its duration, so there were at max 5 wards per team.

I miss Dawngate. I was actually a very good game.
Another reason to dislike EA.

When you don't have to choose between vision and vision denial, the trinkets would become dominated by warding and scanning. Everyone would be forced into participating in the vision war if they didn't want to have a tactical disadvantage, but that means (assuming the current versions of trinkets), red and yellow would be used more, increasing the value of both and preventing people from using blue or the mandrake.

This also probably means that no one would buy sightstone, as yellow ward does equivalent warding, especially when everyone on the team is using it, and you no longer have the benefit of warding and having red trinket, because everyone can do that.

Couple of problems with this.

1)  Sightstone will get abused by other lanes, once again ruining something good support had going for it (heart of gold where?)
2)  Support still doesn't have meaningful item choices, it's just 'which sightstone' to add to 'which gp10'.  The bigger problem is that once you get those, you run out of cheap support-friendly items.
3)  Your build is now even less flexible as you'll have to upgrade your sightstone rather than saving toward an expensive support-friendly item followup.

Other lanes pitching in for vision is good for supports.  That's what you want.
> 2)  Support still doesn't have meaningful item choices, it's just 'which sightstone' to add to 'which gp10'.  The bigger problem is that once you get those, you run out of cheap support-friendly items.

Which sightstone is still 1 more choice than they have now.  And are you really suggesting that Sightstone taking up a slot is a good thing?
> 3)  Your build is now even less flexible as you'll have to upgrade your sightstone rather than saving toward an expensive support-friendly item followup.

Right now, you have to build 4 tier 2 items before building anything else.  With this suggestion you only build 3, making it faster until you can buy the items you want.

You seem to have misunderstood every single one of my points, so I'll clarify.

1)  I'm concerned that other lanes will get your new sightstone nerfed/removed, just like they got the old gp10s removed (like heart of gold).

2)  I don't think this has anything to do w/ how many slots sightstone takes, nor do I think it matters for supports.  If you're worried about slots, there's a much easier fix (vision slot) than creating different enchants and requiring a gp10 item to socket them into.

3)  Currently, I get to choose what I build after I spend my 800 gold on sightstone and 865 gold on a tier 2 gp10.  Under your plan, I then have to finish my gp10 and upgrade my sightstone before I can buy any actually-unique items.  Your system just feels like different flavors of cookie cutter to me rather than presenting actual build diversity.  Hell, once upon a time gp10 was still a real choice too - it wasn't automatic that you'd buy 1 (and only 1) gp10 on support.  And before then, you could choose how much you wanted to invest in wards - now it's automatically a cap of 3.  I didn't like those changes and I similarly don't really care for your sightstone change.  Just my 2c though.

The problem with adopting the jungle item "enchant" system for sightstones is that it would probably copy the problems of the system as well. The jungle is currently being dominated by cinderhulk junglers, with cinderhulk being so strong it's showing up in top lane. When cinderhulk was juggernaut, the warrior enchant was dominating the jungle, with vi and lee sin being a step ahead of the other junglers at all stages of the game. Devourer is okay on some junglers, but clearly suboptimal, and poachers seems to only work on Nunu.

Right now the support meta picks are determined by who can bring the most utility for the adc. If the sightstone system is changed to an enchant system, it could artificially shift the meta in the same way the jungle items have. Probably one enchant would be completely useless, except maybe on one champ. One enchant would be mediocre. One enchant would be decent, and the last enchant would be the meta enchant that everyone feels is the strongest. Champs who use the strongest enchant well would become significantly stronger while champs who don't would become weaker.

For example, two of your new proposed sightstones have mana regen (one with mana, one with ap). This means that mage supports like morgana and annie start building their ap items sooner (assuming no changes to upgraded sightstone costs, gp10 item costs, and a small combine cost, like the jungle items) and they get to have an extra ap item (cough mejais cough). Sure, leona and thresh get to build another tank item, but mage supports would be able to snowball their leads without having to sacrifice warding by opting for the "no sightstone, upgraded yellow trinket" route. We might see zyra and even brand or ryze come to bot lane, until riot decides they need to make adjustments and buffs the health enchant, resulting in a tank support meta where mage supports are practically useless, or at least starting from behind.
